'''Thomas Svanikier''' (born January 1960{{Cite web|title = Mr Thomas Svanikier Director Profile - Endole|url = http://www.endole.co.uk/profile/1327057/thomas-svanikier|website = www.endole.co.uk|accessdate = 2015-08-20}}) is a leading [[Ghana]]ian entrepreneur, industrialist, and philanthropist. He is the founder and executive chairman of Svani Group, an automotive conglomerate, as well as a founder and Chairman of the Advisory Board of Fidelity Bank, a growing international financial institution. Svanikier has been at the forefront of Ghana’s economic modernization over the past 25 years, most notably in the automobile and financial sectors. ==Business story== Thomas Svanikier’s first venture was an automotive import business. Svani Limited, established in 1990, supplied Russian-made Lada cars to Ghanaian industry, NGOs and government agencies, and consumers throughout West Africa. In response to the notable absence of North American automobiles, Svani Limited reintroduced Ford and Lincoln Mercury cars to the Ghanaian market in 1994. Svanikier quickly expanded his company and renamed it Svani Group. The company imports vehicles, leases, rents and sells cars, and is a distributor of generators and other heavy-duty equipment throughout West Africa.{{Cite web|url = http://www.svanigroup.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=section&layout=blog&id=4&Itemid=54|title = About Svani Limited|date = |accessdate = 24 August 2015|website = Svani Limited|publisher = |last = |first = }} Svani has sold armored vehicles to the Office of the President of Ghana, the U.S. Secret Service in Nigeria, the Governor of Lagos State, and the governments of Liberia and Togo. The group also provides automotive maintenance and specialized equipment to the U.S. Department of State in Ghana.{{Cite web|url = http://government-contractors.insidegov.com/l/555873/Svani-Ltd-in-Accra|title = Svani Ltd. in Accra - Contracting Profile|date = |accessdate = 20 August 2015|website = InsideGov.com|publisher = Graphiq, Inc.|last = |first = }} Svani currently controls about 20% of the global vehicles market in Ghana and has service centers in Accra, Takoradi, Koforidua and Kumasi. Svani is also the sole importer and distributor of Mahindra vehicles, as well as the largest distributor of Toyota Land Cruisers and Ford vehicles in Ghana. In partnership with Svanikier’s company, Mahindra built a motorcycle and pickup truck assembly plant in Accra, Ghana.{{Cite web|url = http://artismc.com/index.php/news/article/view/54/988/|title = Mahindra to open auto assembly plant in Ghana|date = 12 August 2013|accessdate = 20 August 2015|website = Artis.com|publisher = Artis Management Consultants Private Limited|last = |first = }} The two companies are currently working on the development of a 9.6 acre car assembly and servicing center along the Accra-Tema motorway.{{cite web|last1=Obour|first1=Samuel K.|title=Svani Motors to establish vehicle assembly plant|url=http://graphic.com.gh/business/business-news/9878-svani-motors-to-establish-vehicle-assembly-plant.html|website=Graphic Online|accessdate=28 August 2015|date=8 August 2013}} A number of Svani-distributed vehicles have received nominations in Ghana’s Auto Awards.{{cite web|title=Nominees|url=http://www.ghanaautoawards.com/nominees|website=Ghana Auto Awards|accessdate=28 August 2015}} Svanikier ventured into private equity with the creation of Africa Capital LLC, which invests in transportation, energy, finance, and real estate projects. As a result, Svanikier is well known in Ghana as a job creator and investor responsible for a significant portion of the economic expansion and modernization between the 1980s and late 2000s.{{Cite book|title = Key events in African history : a reference guide|last = Falola|first = Toyin|publisher = Greenwood Press|year = 2002|isbn = 9780313361227|location = Westport, Conn.|pages = 321}} In 2010, Africa Capital’s energy subsidiary, Atholl Energy, was lauded by then President John Evans Atta Mills for its joint project with the Siemens group to construct a 180-megawatt power generation plant that greatly augmented Ghana’s power supply.{{cite web|title=President lauds Siemens, Atholl power project|url=http://edmingle.blogspot.com/2010/12/president-lauds-siemens-atholl-power.html|website=Mingle's base|accessdate=28 August 2015|date=13 December 2010}} Africa Capital is the largest shareholder of Fidelity Bank in both Ghana and Malaysia. Fidelity is currently the fourth largest bank in Ghana, and is growing rapidly. Fidelity Bank has 98 branches in Ghana and plans to increase that number significantly in the coming years.{{cite news|last1=Dzawu|first1=Moses|title=Rothschild-Backed Fidelity of Ghana to Double Branches|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2014-09-01/rothschild-backed-fidelity-of-ghana-to-double-branches|accessdate=28 August 2015|work=BloombergBusiness|publisher=Bloomberg L.P.|date=2 September 2014}} In December 2014, the bank’s total assets also stood at GHC 3.135 billion. In July 2015, Svanikier and his wife were invited to be part of U.S. President Barack Obama’s delegation during his official visit to Kenya. Svanikier was also asked to take part in the Global Entrepreneurship Summit organized in Nairobi, Kenya by the U.S. Department of Commerce, at which the president met with leading figures in African business circles. As of 2015, Svanikier serves as the senior adviser for Africa for the Transnational Strategy Group,{{cite web|title=The Transnational Strategy Group Team|url=http://transnationalstrategy.com/team/|website=Transnational Strategy Group|accessdate=28 August 2015}} a Washington, D.C.-based{{Cite web|url = http://transnationalstrategy.com/contact/|title = Contact - Transnational Strategy Group|date = |accessdate = 20 August 2015|website = Transnational Strategy Group|publisher = |last = |first = }} company that provides consultancy services for governments and companies on economic and political issues.{{Cite web|url = http://transnationalstrategy.com/|title = Transnational Strategy Group - Home|date = |accessdate = 20 August 2015|website = |publisher = |last = |first = }} ==Portfolio== Svanikier is the co-founder and chairman of several companies: * Africa Capital Ltd., a financial firm * DreamOval Ltd., an internet security technology start-up specializing in data science, enterprise software and cloud services{{Cite web|url = http://www.dreamoval.com/about/|title = About Us - DreamOval|date = |accessdate = 20 August 2015|website = DreamOval|publisher = |last = |first = }} * Atholl Energy Ltd., an energy company * Global Strategic Ventures Ltd., an armored vehicle and security company (Svanikier is also a director of the company{{Cite web|url = https://www.duedil.com/director/906177304/thomas-svanikier|title = Mr Thomas Svanikier, Director Profile at Svani Limited|date = |accessdate = 20 August 2015|website = DueDil|publisher = DueDil Ltd.|last = |first = }}) Svanikier is Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank in both Ghana and Malaysia. Fidelity is one of the fastest growing banks in Ghana – over the past eight years it has created 95 branches throughout the country.{{Cite web|url = http://www.fidelitybank.com.gh/media/photos/OIL__GAS.pdf|title = Energy, Oil & Gas Services|date = |accessdate = 20 August 2015|website = Fidelity Bank|publisher = |last = |first = }} Fidelity Bank has 51 branches in Ghana and plans to increase that number to 100 by the year 2017.{{Cite news|url = https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2014-09-01/rothschild-backed-fidelity-of-ghana-to-double-branches|title = Rothschild-Backed Fidelity of Ghana to Double Branches|last = Dzawu|first = Moses|date = 2 September 2014|work = BloombergBusiness|access-date = 24 August 2015|via = }} Fidelity also provides the financing for Ghanaian customers to purchase or lease Mahindra vehicles produced in Svanikier's Accra plant.{{Cite web|url = http://www.automotivesupplychain.org/news/618/15/Mahindra-and-Svani-Motors-build-assembly-plant-in-Ghana/|title = Mahindra and Svani Motors build assembly plant in Ghana|date = 13 August 2013|accessdate = 20 August 2015|website = Automotive Supply Chain|publisher = Three 6 Zero Limited|last = |first = |location = London}} Additionally, he is a founding member of the American Chamber of Commerce in Ghana. ==Philanthropy== {{Quote box |width = 21.5em |border = 1px |align = |bgcolor = #c6dbf7 |fontsize = 85% |title_bg = |title_fnt = |title = |quoted=yes |quote = It is really gratifying to see organizations like Svani step up and join the fight against Ebola.The response needs equipment, logistical support, technology and innovation and this partnership is going to boost the UN’s efforts to end this horrible disease. |salign = right |source = — Dominic Sam
UNDP Country Director in Accra[http://www.gh.undp.org/content/ghana/en/home/presscenter/pressreleases/2014/12/18/svani-group-joins-private-sector-effort-to-combat-ebola.html "Svani Group joins private sector effort to combat Ebola"]. United Nations Development Programme. 18 December 2014. Retrieved 20 August 2015. }} Svanikier is a well-known philanthropist in Ghana. He serves as a leader for the Opportunities Industrialisation Centre (also known as OIC International). OIC is a non-profit group in Pennsylvania that gives technical and vocational skills training to underprivileged adults and teenagers.{{Cite web|title = About Us {{!}} OIC International|url = http://www.oici.org/about-us/|website = www.oici.org|accessdate = 2015-08-20}} He is also a leader of the Africa Poverty Eradication Commission located in Accra. Svanikier is known as a generous supporter of education and youth development programs, and has donated a 35-seat bus worth $64,000 to Ghana’s renowned Winneba Youth Choir.{{cite web|title=Svani Group Donates Bus To Winneba Youth Choir|url=http://edmingle.blogspot.com/2015/03/svani-group-donates-bus-to-winneba.html|website=Mingle's base|accessdate=28 August 2015|date=9 March 2015}} He is also an ongoing benefactor of the Presbyterian Schools in the Accra neighborhood of Osu. He funded the installation of its clean water and sanitation systems, as well as the construction of its Primary School for girls and a modern library with a computer laboratory. The Girls’ School facilities are dedicated to the memory of his late mother, Agnes Federica Svanikier. In December, 2014, in the midst of the [[Ebola virus epidemic in West Africa|Ebola outbreak in West Africa]], Svani Group partnered with the [[United Nations Development Programme]] (UNDP) in the fight against the Ebola epidemic. Svani Group donated eight heavy-duty vehicles as well as several power generators to the United Nation’s Ebola Emergency Response.{{Cite web|url = http://reliefweb.int/report/sierra-leone/svani-group-joins-private-sector-effort-combat-ebola|title = Svani Group joins private sector effort to combat Ebola|date = 18 December 2014|accessdate = 20 August 2015|website = ReliefWeb|publisher = United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs|last = Owusu|first = Bossman}} In 2015, Svanikier and his wife founded the Svanikier Public Policy Leadership Initiative, which donated $100,000 to the University of Oxford’s School of Government.{{cite web|title=Fidelity Bank {{!}} Board of Directors|url=http://www.fidelitybank.com.gh/who-we-are/board-of-directors/?d=31|website=Fidelity Bank|accessdate=28 August 2015}} The funds went towards sponsorship for six Ghanaian public officials to attend courses at the University focused on Governance and Natural Resource management. ==Personal== Svanikier is a descendent of a Danish family that settled in Christiansburg, Osu, in Accra.{{Cite web|title = Goodman AMC: THOMAS SVANIKIER|url = http://goodmanamc.blogspot.com/p/thomas-svanikier-43-0million-executive.html|accessdate = 2015-08-20}} Svanikier is married and has a son and two daughters. His wife, [[Johanna Odonkor Svanikier]], was a [[Fulbright Program|Fulbright Scholar]] who studied at Oxford and [[Harvard University|Harvard Universities]]. Johanna Odonkor-Svanikier is currently Ghana’s Ambassador to France, Portugal and [[UNESCO]].{{Cite web|title = Home - Ghana Embassy, Paris|url = http://paris.embassy.gov.gh/|website = paris.embassy.gov.gh|accessdate = 2015-08-20}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.fidelitybank.com.gh Fidelity Bank Ghana Limited] * [http://www.dreamoval.com DreamOval Limited] * [https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/snapshot.asp?privcapId=41355092 Africa Capital Limited] profile on ''[[Bloomberg L.P.|Bloomberg]]'' {{DEFAULTSORT:Svanikier, Thomas}} [[Category:1960 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Ghanaian businesspeople]] [[Category:Ghanaian philanthropists]]

{{Use Indian English|date=September 2016}} {{Advert|date=August 2012}} {{Infobox recurring event |name =Vista |logo = |founded =2002 |genre = Business festival | years_active = 10 |patron = [[Indian Institute of Management Bangalore]] |location =[[Bengaluru]], [[Karnataka]] |country =[[India]] |website =[http://www.iimb-vista.com www.iimb-vista.com] }} '''Vista''', is the annual international business summit hosted by [[IIM Bangalore]]. The summit spanning across three days can be defined as the "coming together of academia and industry". The event brings together the leaders of every field, like, marketing, finance, operations, human resources, consulting, social work, etc. and provides a platform for students to enhance knowledge in the field learning from veterans through events, competitions and case studies. The event also incorporates several guest speaker sessions and conclaves from people who have inspired generations of Indians into success.
==About IIM Bangalore's Vista== Vista was hosted for the first time by IIM Bangalore in 2002. It is the oldest business festival hosted by a B-school in South India and the 4th oldest in India behind [[Manfest| Manfest (IIM Lucknow)]], [[Intaglio (Business School Summit)|Intaglio (IIM Calcutta)]] and [[Confluence (IIM Ahmedabad)]].{{citation needed|date=August 2012}} An important feature of Vista is its social intervention each year. Through associations with NGOs and through the social events that it holds and promotes, Vista communicates a social message too.
==Flagship events at Vista==
===Numero Uno=== Numero Uno, one of the flagship events of Vista, is a three-day event which provides participants a platform to put themselves in the shoes of CEOs and face challenging business situations. The event is open to students from select B-schools in India. Participants are tested on their knowledge, expertise and application in various domains like finance, strategy, marketing, operations etc. to be crowned the Numero Uno among the budding leaders of the nation.<ref name="iimb-vista">[http://www.iimb-vista.com Vista 2011<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
===Bizarre=== True to its name, Bizarre, an unconventional open quiz, gives an opportunity to the corporates and students alike in the domain of quizzing by cashing in on their business knowledge and fundamentals. [[Harsha Bhogle]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FqXn1grPcok |title=Harsha Bhogle at IIM Bangalore |publisher=YouTube |date=2007-11-01 |accessdate=2012-08-27}}</ref> [[Derek O'Brien (quizmaster)|Derek O Brien]], Gautam Bhimani, Barry O brien have donned the quiz master’s hat in previous editions of Bizarre.<ref name="iimb-vista" />
===Excelsior=== Excelsior is an exclusive invite only event where participants use negotiation and strategy in multiple rounds of finance, strategy and marketing to grow their firms and battle it out in the ultimate challenge of the firms.<ref name="iimb-vista" />
===Street Smart=== Street Smart is an insight into the world of investment bankers and gives the participants a chance to experience mergers, acquisitions and other financial issues. The participants face many challenges in the form of pitching, be it a pitch to buy or a pitch to sell, to win the title of master negotiator by sealing the ultimate deal.<ref name="iimb-vista" />
===Finesse=== Finesse is a multi-year simulation game with elements of case analysis spanning the whole life of a private equity investment right from entry, to management, on to exit. The event is a test of the participants' judgement, strategy and risk-taking abilities.<ref name="iimb-vista" />
===Bzzwings=== Bzzwings,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dare2compete.com/competitions/event_view.php?id=4154 |title=Bzzwings - B-plan Competition-Indian Institute of Management (IIM), Bangalore-Management-Business Plan-General |publisher=Dare2compete.com |date= |accessdate=2012-08-27}}</ref> is an open theme B-plan contest is a chance for the participants to fulfil their entrepreneurial dreams. The selected teams for the final round are provided mentoring by Vista’s Knowledge Partners to assist them in their preparations and spruce up their plans before entering the contest. The winning team takes home not only the prize money but also an opportunity of incubation of the plan.<ref name="iimb-vista" />
===Biztrotter=== Biztrotter is a unique online quizzing event that happens a week before Vista which takes the participants on a virtual tour of more than 40 cities across the world by simply answering questions pertaining to the business and economy of the respective regions. The event has participation of 1500+ from different parts of the world.
==Previous editions==
===Vista 2012=== The 2012 Vista was modelled on the theme "Challenge Convention, Transform Tomorrow" and was held from 28 to 30 September on the campus. [[Tata Administrative Services|Tata Administrative Services (TAS)]] continued to be the title sponsor this year, along with being a flagship event sponsor too. The inaugural ceremony was presided over by Dr. Devanath Tirupati, dean- academic, IIM Bangalore. The other dignitaries for the inaugural ceremony were [[Devi Shetty|Dr. Devi Shetty]], founder, Narayana Hrudayalaya Multi-Specialty Hospital and Mr. Ajoy Chawla, vice president and Global Business Head- Titan. The three day fest saw a multitude of events being conducted including the flagship events. This gave an opportunity to the participants to learn about the many facets of the managerial world. Influential personalities who had challenged social conventions in some form or the other visited the campus to interact with students. Some of the stalwarts on the list were the Indian chess grandmaster, [[Tania Sachdev]], CEO of JP Morgan India Kalpana Morparia, singer [[Neha Bhasin]] were a part of the Media Conclave. This marked an apt conclusion to Vista 2012, with the audience being inspired to make a difference by challenging convention, through insight into the lives of these dignitaries.
===Vista 2011=== With its theme, "Be the change", Vista 2011 was held from 30 September to 2 October. The title sponsor for this year was the [[Tata Administrative Services|Tata Administrative Services (TAS)]]. The festival was inaugurated through speeches from several stalwarts from the industry, academia and politics. The guest speakers included [[Jayaprakash Narayan (Lok Satta)|Mr. J P Narayan]], the political leader from Andhra Pradesh, Mr. Bhaskar Bhatt, the managing director of Titan, and Mr. N S Ramaswamy, the founder of IIM Bangalore. Vista 2011 also hosted several celebrities and individuals of opinion who have "been a change", either through their thought or work. Vista served as an interface between these trend setters and trend breakers, and the students of IIM, Bangalore through a Media Conclave where the guests shared their experiences and learnings through life and discussed and debated on the theme "Be the change". The celebrities who visited IIM, Bangalore during Vista, 2011 for the Vista Media Conclave were Ms. [[Nandita Das]], Mr. [[Narain Karthikeyan|Narain Kartikeyan]] and [[N. Santosh Hegde|Justice Hegde]]. Vista 2011 partnered with Wishberry to help support a social cause in sync with the main theme wherein an online contribution to the Vista-NGO Fund could be made and the contribution was used for the benefit of the NGOs namely, Samarthanam, Snehasadan and Seva-In-Action<ref>{{cite web|url=http://sevainaction.org/93 |title=Seva-In-Action selected by IIMB Vista for its case-study |publisher=Seva In Action |date= |accessdate=2012-08-27}}</ref> which are supported by IIM Bangalore. Vista 2011 also organized social events like the "Run for change" where the IIM Bangalore student community under the Vista banner and took a lap of the IIM Bangalore campus. The students wore T-shirts and carried banners and through press coverage sang out the message of "Be the change" for the world to hear.
===Vista 2010-11=== Vista 2010-11 was held in October.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.twenty19.com/opportunities/organiser/iim-bangalore/vista-2010-bschool-festival |title=Vista 2010: BSchool festival |publisher=Twenty19.com |date= |accessdate=2012-08-27}}</ref> It was an opportunity to discuss India’s metamorphosis from a key regional player to a global player and the challenges and issues faced in the process under the theme "Scripting the future". The fest was a forum for exchange of views on the topic by eminent personalities across all fields. Mr. [[Arun Shourie]], [[Gul Panag]], Mr. [[M J Akbar]], Ms. [[Shobhaa De]] were some of the prominent personalities who graced the occasion. The fest had a range of flagship events like Numero Uno, Software Czars,<ref>[http://www.raveeshkumar.com/2010/09/iimb-vista-2010-annual-business.html Ee Prapancha: IIM Bangalore's Annual Business Festival - Vista 2010<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Darwin’s Darling, Optimus covering spread across fields of marketing, social responsibility, strategy etc. Hence, Vista gave an opportunity to the participants to foresee the future and play their part in "Scripting the future".<ref>[http://iimbvista2010.wordpress.com/ IIMB Vista 2010-11 | IIM-Bangalore's premier business fest<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
===Vista 2010=== Vista 2010<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mybangalore.com/events/vista-2010-at-iimb.html |title=Vista 2010 at IIMB | Events in Bangalore | January 2010 |publisher=Mybangalore.com |date= |accessdate=2012-08-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://dare2compete.com/competitions/event_view.php?id=1087 |title=Vista 2010-Indian Institute of Management (IIM), Bangalore-Management-Others-General |publisher=Dare2compete.com |date= |accessdate=2012-08-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=indian (not verified) |url=http://www.edu-leaders.com/content/iim-bangalore-fest-vista-10-goes-green |title=IIM Bangalore fest -Vista' 10 Goes Green |publisher=Edu-Leaders |date= |accessdate=2012-08-27}}</ref> was held in January. Recognizing the fact that in the 21st century, global warming and climate change were the most compelling problems for the world, Vista 2010,<ref>{{cite web|author=Aparna Datta |url=http://www.indiaprwire.com/pressrelease/education/2010012942351.htm |title=IIM Bangalore business fest -Vista' 10 Goes Green and Sustainable |publisher=Indiaprwire.com |date=2010-01-30 |accessdate=2012-08-27}}</ref> as one of India's premier business fests, decided to go green. The theme for this year was "India at the crossroads".<ref>[http://www.asklaila.com/article/Bangalore/IIMB-Vista-2010-Another-round-of-fun-and-frolic-in-Bangalore/138069/ IIMB Vista 2010 - Another round of fun and frolic in Bangalore, Bangalore - asklaila<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> There were a range of events spanning marketing, strategy, finance and social responsibility. Vista also served as a platform for discussion on the theme by prominent personalities like [[Mani Shankar Aiyar]], [[Meera Sanyal]] and Rohan Parikh to develop new road maps for encouraging inclusive growth and to find ways in which the corporate sector could catalyse this metamorphosis and help India ease into the right path with everyone on board.<ref>[http://www.pagalguy.com/forums/life-at-b-schools/vista-2010-at-iimb-t-48195/p-1794295 Vista 2010 @ IIMB : Life @ B-Schools : PaGaLGuY Forums<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mbauniverse.com/article.php?id=3671 |title=IIM Bangalore adds new competitions to Vista, starts Oct 1 |publisher=MBAUniverse.com |date=2010-09-30 |accessdate=2012-08-27}}</ref>
===Vista 2008=== ‘Emerging economies. Emerging realities’ was the theme of 2008 edition of Vista<ref>http://www.iimb.ernet.in/newsletter-archive/IIMB%20Fortnightly%20Oct%201.pdf</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/bangalore/report_iim-b-hosts-ngos-at-vista-2008_1197037 |title=IIM-B hosts NGOs at Vista 2008 - Bangalore - DNA |publisher=Dnaindia.com |date=2008-10-10 |accessdate=2012-08-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mbauniverse.com/article.php?id=1486 |title=MBA Universe |publisher=Mbauniverse.com |date= |accessdate=2012-08-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mbauniverse.com/article.php?id=646 |title=MBA Universe |publisher=Mbauniverse.com |date= |accessdate=2012-08-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mbauniverse.com/article.php?id=1476 |title=MBA Universe |publisher=Mbauniverse.com |date= |accessdate=2012-08-27}}</ref> that explored the beginnings of these economies and their rise to prominence and their struggles.<ref>[http://www.iimbvista2008.blogspot.in/ Vista- The Business Fest of IIMB<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> The title sponsor was AT & T along with a host of partners including Tata, ONGC, NTPC etc. The fest saw prominent personalities like [[Rajat Sharma]], [[Gurcharan Das]], [http://www.zoominfo.com/#!search/profile/person?personId=436290814&targetid=profile Jayanta Roy]- Principal Adviser, CII; [http://www.ficci.com/about-secretariatpic.asp Manab Majumdar], Senior Director of FICCI; provide their insights on the on emerging economies particularly in the Asian context. Various events held across 3 days like Numero Uno, Retailer, Papyrus etc. were highlights of the fest.<ref>http://www.iimbaa.org/IIMBAA/Magazines/2008/winter%2008/IIM_MAGZINE_Dec4.pdf</ref>
===Vista 2007=== Based on the theme of ‘Redefine, ReDiscover, ReFocus and Rebusiness’, Vista 2007<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mbauniverse.com/article.php?id=625 |title=MBA Universe |publisher=Mbauniverse.com |date= |accessdate=2012-08-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mbauniverse.com/article.php?id=641 |title=MBA Universe |publisher=Mbauniverse.com |date= |accessdate=2012-08-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mbauniverse.com/article.php?id=647 |title=MBA Universe |publisher=Mbauniverse.com |date= |accessdate=2012-08-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mbauniverse.com/article.php?id=652 |title=MBA Universe |publisher=Mbauniverse.com |date= |accessdate=2012-08-27}}</ref> was all about exploring new frontiers of innovation in management, strategy, human resources, finance and marketing.<ref>[http://iimbvista.blogspot.com Vista 2K7 : An Insider's View<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> This edition of Vista had the presence of eminent speakers including Arnab Goswami, Editor-in-chief, Times Now; Jehangir S. Pocha, Editor, BusinessWorld; Surendra Jain, MD, Sequoia Capital India; Shankar Narayanan, MD, Carlyle PE India and Sri Rajan, Partner, Bain & Co. T. V. Mohandas Pai, Member of the Board and Head – Administration, Human Resources and Education & Research at Infosys delivered the keynote address at the management conclave<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mbauniverse.com/article.php?id=643 |title=MBA Universe |publisher=Mbauniverse.com |date= |accessdate=2012-08-27}}</ref>
===Vista 2006=== Vista 2006<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rediff.com/getahead/report/iycu5/20061011.htm |title=VISTA 2006: IIM-Bangalore's biz fest - Rediff.com Get Ahead |publisher=Rediff.com |date=2006-10-11 |accessdate=2012-08-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thehindubusinessline.in/2006/10/12/stories/2006101201321900.htm |title=The Hindu Business Line : IIM-B meet to focus on borderless biz |publisher=Thehindubusinessline.in |date=2006-10-12 |accessdate=2012-08-27}}</ref> was centered on the theme of ‘Business Beyond Boundaries’ and was held on 13, 14 and 15 October.<ref>[http://www.rediff.com/getahead/2006/oct/11iycu5.htm VISTA 2006: IIM-Bangalore's biz fest<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> The fest saw participation from over 100 business schools and universities from all over India and over 6000 online participants. There was a wide range of events including the Keynote Speaker Address, Panel Discussion, Media Conclave, Workshops, Games, Paper Presentations, the Biz-Quiz and many others. [http://www.unilever.com/aboutus/companystructure/unileverexecutive/dougbaillie.aspx Doug Bailie], CEO, Unilever; [http://www.livemint.com/2010/09/24211341/Brooks-Entwistle--The-insider.html Brooks Entwistle], CEO, Goldman Sachs; [[N. Ram|N Ram]], editor, The Hindu were some of the key speakers.<ref>[http://www.coolavenues.com/bschools/061016/iimb_vista06_1.php Complete Round-up of VISTA 2006, the Business Fest at IIM Bangalore<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
===Vista 2005=== Vista 2005<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rediff.com/getahead/2005/oct/28iycu.htm |title=VISTA 2005: The business festival |publisher=Rediff.com |date=2005-10-28 |accessdate=2012-08-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hindu.com/2005/10/27/stories/2005102720940300.htm |title=Karnataka / Bangalore News : Engineers told to explore the world of science |publisher=The Hindu |date=2005-10-27 |accessdate=2012-08-27}}</ref> was centered on the idea 'India Inc. - Dream, Explore, Discover' and explored to create a road map for the future of Indian corporations.<ref name="coolavenues">{{cite web|url=http://www.coolavenues.com/bschools/100524/iimb_vista_1.php3|title=VISTA 2005 @ IIM Bangalore|publisher=coolavenues.com|accessdate=2014-02-14}}</ref> The summit was inaugurated by Mr. [[Mukesh Ambani]]. Vista ’05 was organized along the lines of a case study and the discussions addressed the theme with the help of the various verticals such as marketing, finance, operations, strategy, systems and economics. The keynote addresses took place in the form of an intense panel discussion between the President of NASCOMM - Mr. [[Kiran Karnik]], CEO of Biocon Group - Ms. [[Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw|Kiran Majumdar Shaw]] and the MD and Vice Chairman of ABB - Mr. [http://www02.abb.com/global/abbzh/abbzh252.nsf/bf177942f19f4a98c1257148003b7a0a/4d6798b3c5c34eb5c12573090028ee17/$FILE/CV+Ravi+Uppal.pdf Ravi Uppal] moderated by Mckinsey. It attracted about 8000 footfalls over 3 days and participation from 400+ students from over 70 business schools and 200 of India's best postgraduate and undergraduate colleges.<ref name="coolavenues2">{{cite web|url=http://www.coolavenues.com/bschools/100524/iimb_vista_3.php3|title=VISTA 2005 @ IIM Bangalore|publisher=coolavenues.com|accessdate=2014-02-14}}</ref>
===Vista 2003=== "Beyond Vision Statements-Mission Execution" was the theme of Vista 2003<ref>{{cite web|author=Business Standard |url=http://www.business-standard.com/india/news/iim-b-to-hold-vista-2003/139726/ |title=IIM-B to hold Vista 2003 |publisher=Business-standard.com |date=2003-10-29 |accessdate=2012-08-27}}</ref> which focussed on the practical issues faced by the companies in translating their vision into reality. Corporate Partnerships included enduring alliances with leading companies like Tata Sons, ITC, Tata Motors, Sify and Hutch. There was participation not only from premier B-Schools in India but also from prominent international schools like [[London Business School]], Graduate School of Business, University of Chicago, McGill, UCLA and NYU Stern. Activities ranging from presentations by academic experts and senior managers in the panel discussion being conducted by CNBC, to the business quiz being hosted by Siddhartha Basu, Vista gave the participants an opportunity to actively discuss their experiences, contribute insights on the issues faced by corporate India and challenge their intellect in stimulating informal sessions.<ref name="coolavenues3">{{cite web|url=http://www.coolavenues.com/bschools/iimb_press_vista2003.php3|title=bschools/iimb_press_vista2003|publisher=coolavenues.com|accessdate=2014-02-14}}</ref>
===Vista 2002=== VISTA 2002 was flagged off by Mr. [[Kumar Mangalam Birla]], Chairman, [[Aditya Birla Group]]. The fest attracted a host of corporate sponsors including HUL, ITC, Standard Chartered, Tata Group and Colgate Palmolive. A host of events –Ad-Age, Manifestations, Money Matters, Bizarre were conducted and there was participation from premier B-Schools in the country including IIMA, IIMC, NITIE and S. P. Jain. Three days of action and learning were aided by the synergy of the corporate world, management students from around the country and academia. It truly lived up to its theme for the year, "Making the Connection".<ref name="coolavenues4">{{cite web|url=http://www.coolavenues.com/bschools/iimb_vista.php3|title=bschools/iimb_vista|publisher=coolavenues.com|accessdate=2014-02-14}}</ref>

{{Infobox scientist |name = Walter A. Shewhart |image = WalterShewhart.gif |image_size = |caption = Walter A. Shewhart |birth_date = {{birth date|1891|03|18|mf=y}} |birth_place = [[New Canton, Illinois]], U.S. |death_date = {{death date and age|1967|03|11|1891|03|18|mf=y}} |death_place = [[Parsippany-Troy Hills, New Jersey|Troy Hills]], [[New Jersey]], U.S. |residence = |citizenship = |nationality = American |ethnicity = |fields = physics, engineering, statistics |workplaces = [[Western Electric]] |alma_mater = [[University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign|University of Illinois]], [[University of California, Berkeley]] |doctoral_advisor = |academic_advisors = |doctoral_students = |notable_students = |known_for = |author_abbrev_bot = |author_abbrev_zoo = |influences = |influenced = |awards = |religion = |signature = |footnotes = }} '''Walter Andrew Shewhart''' (pronounced like "shoe-heart", March 18, 1891 – March 11, 1967) was an [[United States|American]] [[physicist]], [[engineer]] and [[statistician]], sometimes known as the ''father of [[Statistical process control|statistical quality control]]'' and also related to the [[PDCA|Shewhart cycle]]. [[W. Edwards Deming]] said of him:
As a statistician, he was, like so many of the rest of us, self-taught, on a good background of physics and mathematics.{{cite journal|last1=Deming|first1=W. Edwards|title=Walter A. Shewhart, 1891-1967|journal=The American Statistician|date=1967|volume=21|issue=2|pages=39–40|jstor=1401495}}
Born in [[New Canton, Illinois]] to Anton and Esta Barney Shewhart, he attended the [[University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign]] before being awarded his doctorate in [[physics]] from the [[University of California, Berkeley]] in 1917. He married Edna Elizabeth Hart, daughter of William Nathaniel and Isabelle "Ibie" Lippencott Hart on August 4, 1914 in Pike County, Illinois. ==Work on industrial quality== [[Bell Telephone Company|Bell Telephone]]’s engineers had been working to improve the reliability of their [[transmission system]]s. In order to impress government regulators of this natural monopoly with the high quality of their service, Shewhart's first assignment was to improve the voice clarity of the carbon transmitters in the company's telephone handsets. Later he applied his statistical methods to the final installation of central station switching systems, then to factory production. When Shewhart joined the [[Western Electric|Western Electric Company]] Inspection Engineering Department at the [[Hawthorne Works]] in 1918, [[Quality (business)|industrial quality]] was limited to inspecting finished products and removing defective items. That all changed on May 16, 1924. Shewhart's boss, [[George D. Edwards]], recalled: "Dr. Shewhart prepared a little memorandum only about a page in length. About a third of that page was given over to a simple diagram which we would all recognize today as a schematic [[control chart]]. That diagram, and the short text which preceded and followed it, set forth all of the essential principles and considerations which are involved in what we know today as process quality control."{{cite web |url=http://www.porticus.org/bell/westernelectric_history.html#Western%20Electric%20-%20A%20Brief%20History |title=Western Electric — A Brief History |publisher=The Porticus Centre |accessdate=2009-04-10 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5wDkkOkcj?url=http://www.porticus.org/bell/westernelectric_history.html |archivedate=2011-02-03 |df= }} Shewhart's work pointed out the importance of reducing variation in a manufacturing process and the understanding that continual process-adjustment in reaction to non-conformance actually increased variation and degraded quality. Shewhart framed the problem in terms of [[Common cause and special cause (statistics)|assignable-cause]] and [[Common cause and special cause (statistics)|chance-cause]] variation and introduced the control chart as a tool for distinguishing between the two. Shewhart stressed that bringing a production process into a state of [[Statistical process control|statistical control]], where there is only chance-cause variation, and keeping it in control, is necessary to predict future output and to manage a process economically. Dr. Shewhart created the basis for the control chart and the concept of a state of statistical control by carefully designed experiments. While Dr. Shewhart drew from pure mathematical statistical theories, he understood data from physical processes never produce a "[[normal distribution]] curve" (a Gaussian distribution, also commonly called a "bell curve"). He discovered that observed variation in manufacturing data did not always behave the same way as data in nature ([[Brownian motion]] of particles). Dr. Shewhart concluded that while every process displays variation, some processes display controlled variation that is natural to the process, while others display uncontrolled variation that is not present in the process causal system at all times.{{cite book |last=Neave |first=Henry R. |author2=British Deming Association |title=Why SPC? |publisher=SPC Press |location=Knoxville, Tennessee |year=1992 |isbn=978-0-945320-17-3}} Shewhart worked to advance the thinking at [[Bell Labs|Bell Telephone Laboratories]] from their foundation in 1925 until his retirement in 1956, publishing a series of papers in the ''[[Bell System Technical Journal]]''. His work was summarized in his book ''Economic Control of Quality of Manufactured Product'' (1931). Shewhart’s charts were adopted by the [[ASTM International|American Society for Testing and Materials]] (ASTM) in 1933 and advocated to improve production during [[World War II]] in American War Standards Z1.1-1941, Z1.2-1941 and Z1.3-1942. ==Later work== From the late 1930s onwards, Shewhart's interests expanded out from industrial quality to wider concerns in [[science]] and [[statistical inference]]. The title of his second book, ''Statistical Method from the Viewpoint of Quality Control'' (1939), asks the audacious question: "What can [[statistical]] practice, and [[science]] in general, learn from the experience of industrial quality control?" Shewhart's approach to [[statistics]] was radically different from that of many of his contemporaries. He possessed a strong [[Operationalization|operationalist]] outlook, largely absorbed from the writings of [[pragmatism|pragmatist]] philosopher [[Clarence Irving Lewis]], and this influenced his statistical practice. In particular, he had read Lewis' ''Mind and the World Order'' many times. Though he lectured in [[England]] in 1932 under the sponsorship of [[Karl Pearson]] (another committed operationalist) his ideas attracted little enthusiasm within the English statistical tradition. The [[British Standards]] nominally based on his work, in fact, diverge on serious philosophical and methodological issues from his practice. His more conventional work led him to formulate the statistical idea of [[tolerance interval]]s and to propose his data presentation rules, which are listed below: # Data have no meaning apart from their context. # Data contain both signal and noise. To be able to extract information, one must separate the signal from the noise within the data. Walter Shewhart visited [[India]] in 1947–1948 under the sponsorship of [[Prasanta Chandra Mahalanobis|P. C. Mahalanobis]] of the [[Indian Statistical Institute]]. He toured the country, held conferences and stimulated interest in statistical quality control among Indian industrialists.[http://www.isical.ac.in/history.html "A Brief History of the Indian Statistical Institute"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060618065244/http://www.isical.ac.in/history.html |date=2006-06-18 }} He died at [[Parsippany-Troy Hills, New Jersey|Troy Hills, New Jersey]] in 1967. ==Influence== In 1938 his work came to the attention of [[physicist]]s [[W. Edwards Deming]] and [[Raymond T. Birge]]. The two had been deeply intrigued by the issue of measurement error in science and had published a landmark paper in ''Reviews of Modern Physics'' in 1934. On reading of Shewhart's insights, they wrote to the journal to wholly recast their approach in the terms that Shewhart advocated. The encounter began a long collaboration between Shewhart and [[W. Edwards Deming|Deming]] that involved work on [[productivity]] during [[World War II]] and [[W. Edwards Deming|Deming]]'s championing of Shewhart's ideas in [[Japan]] from 1950 onwards. [[W. Edwards Deming|Deming]] developed some of Shewhart's methodological proposals around [[scientific inference]] and named his synthesis the [[Shewhart cycle]]. To celebrate his quasquicentennial (125th) birth Anniversary, the Quality Technology and Quantitative Managementhttp://web.it.nctu.edu.tw/qtqm/ (QTQM) ({{ISSN|1684-3703}}) journal plans to produce a special issue in early 2017 on "Advances in the Theory and Application of Statistical Process Control".http://web.it.nctu.edu.tw/qtqm/qtqmindex/CFP_QTQM_ASPC_Shewhart.pdf The special issue will be edited by Prof. Min Xie of [[City University of Hong Kong]] and Dr. Amitava Mukherjee of [[XLRI - Xavier School of Management]], Jamshedpur, India. ==Achievements and honours== In his obituary for the [[American Statistical Association]], [[W. Edwards Deming|Deming]] wrote of Shewhart:
As a man, he was gentle, genteel, never ruffled, never off his dignity. He knew disappointment and frustration, through failure of many writers in mathematical statistics to understand his point of view.
He was founding editor of the ''Wiley Series in Mathematical Statistics'', a role that he maintained for twenty years, always championing [[freedom of speech]] and confident to publish views at variance with his own.
